result.execSummary:
The defendant Randolph L Didomizio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
IT IS ORDERED that the hold in case No. 2021AP636-CRNM is hereby lifted.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the judgments are summarily affirmed. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Vicki Zick is relieved of any further
representation of Randolph Didomizio in this matter. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

ADDRESS INFO for Randolph L Didomizio
Current: 1453 South 80th St, West Allis, WI 53214 United States  (Effective: 05-16-2020)
Prior: Jefferson Co Jail 411 S Center St, Jefferson, WI 53549
DOC Balance Inquiry
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief from mailed to Def @ DCI

[MK] cases #15CF13 and #15CF354 called at 1:49pm. 
Defendant Randolph L Didomizio appears via videoconferencing from the Dodge Correctional Institution, in custody.  Defense Counsel Attorney Jessica Klein appears by telephone.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears by telephone for the State of Wisconsin.  Dept. of Corrections Agent Aleesha Gillingham appears by telephone.  
The Court verifies with Mr. Didomizio that he can see and hear the proceedings via the video and audio conferencing system. Attorney Klein and Mr. Didomizio individually waive the right to be physically present for the sentencing hearing.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance. 
Sentencing arguments are given by counsel. 
_________________
In Case #15CF13-Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Didomizio to:
--serve 9 months in Jail, concurrent with Count #2 but consecutive to any other sentence 

In Case #15CF13-Count #2 the Court sentences Mr. Didomizio to:
--serve 90 days in Jail, conconcurrent with Count #1 but consecutive to any other sentence 
Days credit for time already served given: 25 days
The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for any balance due on court financial obligations. 
__________________

In Case #15CF354-Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Didomizio to 2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year.  This sentence is consecutive to any other sentence in being.  
The Court finds that Mr. Didomizio is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Didomizio is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 11 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision the same conditions as were ordered with Probation [which are :
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any recommended treatment as required by the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as required by the Agent
--no contact with Eugenia Garcia unless approved by both the Agent and also by Ms. Garcia
--no possession of any dangerous weapons
--no acts or threats of violence
--to complete Certified Batterers Intervention programming
--not to possess or consume alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no possession of controlled subtances without a valid prescription
The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for any balance due on court financial obligations. 
The Court orally informs Mr. Didomizio of his right to appeal and the Court directs Attorney Klein to go over the Postconviction-rights form with Mr. Didomizio and then file that form.
recess 2:32pm.
Third Party letter submitted on behalf of the defendant.
Third Party Letter submitted on behalf of Defendant
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 12, 2020 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Randolph L Didomizio

[MK] cases #15CF13 and #15CF354 called at 3:00pm 
Attorney Jessica A Klein appears by telephone.  ADA Theresa Beck appears by telephone for the State of Wisconsin, along with Probation Agent Gillingham who also appears by telephone.
These cases are scheduled for Sentencing After Revocation today and arrangments had been made for Defendant Randolph Didomizio to appear by videoconference from the Jefferson County Jail,  however the Court and counsel have learned that Mr. Didomizio is currently at Dodge Correctional Institution.
On agreement of counsel the Court will reschedule the hearing.  The Court directs Attorney Klein to contact DCI to inquire if they foresee Mr. Didomizio remaining at that facility for the foreseeable future due to the pandemic status; any information that she learns related to scheduling-timing should be communicated to the Court's Judicial Assistant. 
recess 3:05pm.  

NEXT:  reschedule Sentencing After Revocation in approximately 2-3 weeks;  arrangements should be made for Mr. Didomizio to appear by v/c from DCI
Routed to JA for further review. 4/17/20--ma

records.addlTxt:
[MK] cases #15CF13, #15CF46, #15CF136, #15CF296, #15CF354 called at 10:44am. 
Defendant Randolph L Didomizio in court, in custody, with Attorney David G Makovec.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court reviews the Criminal Case Settlement form with Mr. Didomizio, verifying that Mr. Didomizio understands and joins in the agreement.  The subject maximum penalties and elements are recited. 
Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "Guilty " entered on Case 15CF13-Count #1 and Count #2, 15CF46-Count #3, 15CF136-Count #1, 15CF296-Count #1, 15CF354-Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Didomizio guilty, and orders Judgments of Convictions entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case 15CF13-Counts #3 and 4; Case 15CF46-Counts #1 and 2 and 4 and 5. Further, after Attorney Makovec recites the factual basis for the read-in, the Court reads in an uncharged referral for Bailjumping on 1/30/15 (DA Case #15JE221) and thereafter bars the State from further prosecution of this referral.

On Cases #15CF46-Count 3, #15CF136, #15CF296 each, the Court sentences Mr. Didomizio to: 
--serve 60 days in the Jefferson County Jail, forthwith with each term consecutive to the other 
--days credit for time already served: 45 days on each case (time served) 
--to pay costs; these costs including DNA surcharge which total $518 on each case, plus in Case #15CF296 to additionally pay $126.80 in Watertown Police Department officer overtime costs;  to be paid in $35 per month installments commencing on 4/30/16 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full.  Non-payment will result in 7 days jail in each case, consecutive
--to provide DNA sample upon demand


On Case #15CF13-Counts #1 and #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Didomizio on Probation for two years, with conditions:
On Case #15CF354-Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Didomizio on Probation for three years, with conditions: 

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any recommended treatment
 as required by the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as required by the Agent
--no contact with Eugenia Garcia unless approved by both the Agent and also by Ms. Garcia
--no possession of any dangerous weapons
--no acts or threats of violence
--to complete Certified Batterers Intervention programming
--not to possess or consume alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no possession of controlled subtances without a valid prescription
--to pay costs plus DNA surcharge
 on each count
--as to Case #15CF13 only, also to pay the domestic abuse surcharge of $100 on Count #1 and the domestic abuse surcharge of $100 on Count #2
--as to Case #15CF354 only, also to pay Watertown Police Department officer overtime costs of $118.07
--to provide a DNA sample upon demand. 


Days credit for time already served:  10  days
 on 15CF13, 11 days on case #15CF354
As to the credit applied today, counsel agree that the total time served applicable is 156 days.  Mr. Didomizio agrees that he has now received credit for all time already served on these cases. 
recess 11:26am
[Clerk's post hearing note:  when the clerk issued the Time-to-Pay slip in Cases #15CF46, #15CF136, and #15CF296, she failed to include the $126.80 officer overtime cost in the total amount listed to pay. Therefore please mail corrected time-to pay/amount information to the Defendant. ]
